messages.body: $ACI Was looking at buying REITs. Then I realized this is kind of a REIT. Huge property holdings, dividend, and undervalued to boot. And yeah, no rent collection issues lol. (I did end up buying $EQR, $MPW, $WRE, $WPC, too)

$WRE Hit new lows recently. With almost 100 percent rent collection IIRC. DC is one of the most stable commercial and residential markets in country, even growing. Ridiculous. Also like $EQR, $MPW. Buy the fear. In my metro, city apartments are being snapped up fast. Real assets are real assets. Urbanization trends centuries in making don't evaporate overnight.
$MPW could spend billions on healthcare acquisitions in the coming year.

messages.body: $MPW  Not much to say here, solid rent collection numbers and earnings guidance, good dividend, but the market seems to be calling it fully valued at  $18, rather than where the analysts' price targets are.

$MPW continues to be an undervalued asset with secure yield and great underlying assets, so valuable right now. Excellent hedge against a market with robust multiple expansion, a Fed very open about being willing to correct for running under on inflation target and so at some point we can expect to be running over that 2% water mark for a meaningful amount of time, meanwhile debt is cheap, where is the angle against this? COVID? No, elective procedures pile up they don’t go away. Tele health can’t disrupt this type of point of care, you can’t tele health an ER visit, an MRI, or a bypass surgery. Owning the hospitals is some of the best value in the real estate sector IMO.

$MPW reported 3Q20 NFFO of $0.41 [up 28.1% y/y] vs est of $0.39 [beat 5.12%] & Revs of $329.5M [up 46.6% y/y] vs est of $315.27M [beat of 4.5%].

Div Yield: 5.64%

3Q20 rent collection rate: 98%

Guides FY20 EPS of $168-$1.71 vs est of $1.56

Collection of materially all current rent & interest due from operators expected in 4Q20 with definitive agreements in place to collect, with interest, the 2% of 2020 rents previously deferred due to the COVID-19 pandemic

US healthcare spending increased 8.8% CAGR & without a single decrease since CMS began recording data in 1960
$MPW I didn't listen to the earnings call, but report looked pretty good. Needs to break this down sloping TL though and get heading up again.
CFRA reiterates Buy Rating on $MPW & keeps TP of $23

$MPW Medical Properties +3.4% on Q3 beat, robust outlook 

https://newsfilter.io/a/ebf3bda4e33b4f5d3cb86ae50df0d22b

links.title: Medical Properties +3.4% on Q3 beat, robust outlook
links.description: Medical Properties Trust shares gain 3.4% in premarket trading after Q3 normalized FFO beats consensus and the REIT says it's collecting "substantially" 100% of current rent and interest due from tenants.Sees annual run-rate of $1.68-$1.71 normalized FFO per share, based on YTD transactions, the same as its guidance issued in July."Operating conditions continue to approach and, in some instances, exceed pre-COVID levels," said President and CEO Edward K.
